title: GAP-3.4.1: Neural Training Progress Dashboard Data
description:
## PRD Reference
Lines 196-200 of PRD-AI-KANBAN-2045.md

## Specification
Neural Training Progress with SONA metrics, MoE utilization, loss/accuracy graphs, EWC++ status.

## Current Status
PARTIAL - Components exist (TrainingLossChart, ExpertUtilization, EWCStatus, TrainingConfig) but render mock data. No API endpoint or real-time updates.

## Implementation Requirements
- Backend: Neural metrics API from Claude Flow CLI
- WebSocket: Training progress events
- Connect components to real data

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Neural metrics API returns real data
- [ ] Components display live metrics
- [ ] Real-time updates during training
close_reason: Implemented by swarm: API endpoints, UI components, and integrations created

title: GAP-3.2.1: Intelligent Complexity Scoring
description:
## PRD Reference
Line 132 of PRD-AI-KANBAN-2045.md

## Specification
Automatic complexity scoring (1-10)

## Current Status
PARTIAL - Database field Ticket.complexity exists, complexity.ts has scoring logic, but NOT exposed in UI and NOT auto-calculated on ticket creation.

## Implementation Requirements
- Call complexity analyzer on ticket create/update
- Display complexity badge on ticket cards
- Allow manual override in ticket edit form

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Complexity auto-calculated on ticket create
- [ ] Complexity badge visible on ticket cards
- [ ] Users can manually override complexity
close_reason: Implemented by swarm: API endpoints, UI components, and integrations created

title: GAP-3.2.4: Ticket Dependency Detection
description:
## PRD Reference
Line 135 of PRD-AI-KANBAN-2045.md

## Specification
Dependency detection across tickets

## Current Status
NOT IMPLEMENTED - dependencies.ts analyzer exists but no dependencies field on Ticket model, no UI, no blocking logic.

## Implementation Requirements
- Add dependencies relation to Ticket model
- UI: Dependency selector in ticket form
- Visual: Show dependency arrows/tree
- Logic: Block transition if dependencies incomplete

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Dependencies can be set on tickets
- [ ] Dependency graph visualized
- [ ] Blocked tickets cannot progress

title: GAP-UX.3: ProjectParallelView - Multi-Project Comparison
description:
## PRD Reference
Line 749 of PRD-AI-KANBAN-2045.md (Appendix B)

## Specification
ProjectParallelView - Multi-project comparison

## Current Status
NOT IMPLEMENTED - No way to view multiple projects side-by-side.

## Implementation Requirements
- Multi-column project view
- Synchronized scrolling option
- Aggregate metrics comparison

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Multiple projects viewable side-by-side
- [ ] Synchronized scrolling works
- [ ] Metrics comparison available

title: GAP-3.1.1: Project Templates
description:
## PRD Reference
Lines 116-120 of PRD-AI-KANBAN-2045.md

## Specification
Pre-configured swarm setups for common use cases:
- 'Web App' template: coder + tester + reviewer agents
- 'Security Audit' template: security-architect + security-auditor
- 'Documentation' template: researcher + api-docs agents

## Current Status
NOT IMPLEMENTED - Users must manually configure agent routing for every project.

## Implementation Requirements
- Add templateId field to Project model
- Create ProjectTemplate model with swarm configurations
- UI: Template selector during project creation
- Seed database with 5-10 standard templates

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Template selector shown in project creation
- [ ] At least 5 templates available (Web App, Security Audit, Documentation, API, ML)
- [ ] Selected template pre-configures swarm settings
close_reason: Implemented by swarm agent: ProjectTemplate schema + migration, 10 seed templates, API endpoints, TemplateSelector component, project creation integration. All acceptance criteria met.

title: GAP-A1.2: Open in Editor Quick Action
description:
## PRD Reference
Line 198 of PRD-AMENDMENT-001-WORKSPACE-PATH.md

## Specification
Provide quick 'Open in Terminal' or 'Open in Editor' actions

## Current Status
NOT IMPLEMENTED

## Implementation Requirements
- Detect available editors (VS Code, etc.)
- Add button to project card
- Generate appropriate URI scheme

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] 'Open in Editor' button on project cards
- [ ] Opens correct folder in VS Code/editor
- [ ] Works across platforms

title: GAP-UX.2: TimeTravelViewer - Decision Replay
description:
## PRD Reference
Line 750 of PRD-AI-KANBAN-2045.md (Appendix B)

## Specification
TimeTravelViewer - Decision replay with what-if

## Current Status
NOT IMPLEMENTED - No way to replay agent decisions or explore alternatives.

## Implementation Requirements
- Store decision snapshots during execution
- Timeline visualization component
- Replay controls (play, pause, step)
- What-if branch exploration
- This is a complex feature

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Decision snapshots stored
- [ ] Timeline shows decision points
- [ ] Replay controls work
- [ ] What-if branching available

title: GAP-3.2.5: Ticket Attachment Support
description:
## PRD Reference
Line 128 of PRD-AI-KANBAN-2045.md

## Specification
Attachments: mockups, specs, reference code

## Current Status
NOT IMPLEMENTED - No file upload capability for tickets.

## Implementation Requirements
- Add Attachment model linked to Ticket
- File upload endpoint with storage (S3/local)
- UI: File drop zone in ticket form
- Display attached files on ticket cards

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Files can be uploaded to tickets
- [ ] Attachments visible on cards
- [ ] Files downloadable

title: GAP-ROAD.1: Redis Integration Completion
description:
## PRD Reference
Lines 369-374 of PRD-AI-KANBAN-2045.md (Phase 2)

## Specification
Redis pub/sub and caching fully active.

## Current Status
PARTIAL - Redis client exists (redis.ts) but pub/sub may not be active, caching not fully utilized.

## Implementation Requirements
- Verify Redis pub/sub is working
- Implement caching for patterns/memory
- Add cache invalidation logic

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Redis pub/sub active for real-time events
- [ ] Pattern queries use Redis cache
- [ ] Cache invalidation on updates
close_reason: Completed Redis integration with 512-line cache layer, pub/sub channels, pattern caching, memory caching, TTL-based invalidation, and health endpoint

title: EPIC: Feature Discovery & Onboarding
description:
## Overview
Features that help users discover Claude Flow's 140+ capabilities and get started quickly.

## Child Issues
- GAP-8.1: AI Chat Assistant (cf-kanban-z1w) - KEY FEATURE
- GAP-8.2: Command Palette Cmd+K (cf-kanban-jbz)
- GAP-8.3: Interactive Tutorials (cf-kanban-i0f)
- GAP-8.4: Capabilities Browser in Sidebar (cf-kanban-d7s)
- GAP-8.5: Contextual Suggestions (cf-kanban-vew)

## Success Criteria
New users can quickly understand what CF-Kanban can do and create their first ticket with confidence.

## PRD Sections
Section 8: Feature Discovery & AI Assistant (Lines 418-683)

title: GAP-3.5.1: Notification Preferences UI
description:
## PRD Reference
Lines 221-226 of PRD-AI-KANBAN-2045.md

## Specification
Notification Preferences: In-app notifications, email digests, webhook integrations, mobile push (future).

## Current Status
NOT IMPLEMENTED - No notification preferences UI. System sends no notifications.

## Implementation Requirements
- Add NotificationPreference model per user
- UI: Settings page for notification config
- Backend: Notification dispatch service
- Email integration (SendGrid/Postmark)
- Webhook dispatcher

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Notification preferences in settings
- [ ] In-app notifications work
- [ ] Email digests configurable
- [ ] Webhooks can be configured

title: EPIC: Ticket Intelligence System
description:
## Overview
Intelligent ticket analysis features including auto-complexity scoring, agent suggestions, and dependency tracking.

## Child Issues
- GAP-3.2.1: Intelligent Complexity Scoring (cf-kanban-0bf)
- GAP-3.2.2: Suggested Agent Assignment (cf-kanban-dkd)
- GAP-3.2.3: Estimated Completion Time (cf-kanban-t2y)
- GAP-3.2.4: Ticket Dependency Detection (cf-kanban-1c3)
- GAP-3.2.5: Ticket Attachment Support (cf-kanban-5l7)
- GAP-3.2.6: Feedback Interaction UI Enhancement (cf-kanban-d84)
- GAP-3.2.7: Natural Language Task Parsing (cf-kanban-zc5)

## Success Criteria
Tickets are automatically analyzed with complexity scores, agent suggestions, and time estimates.

## PRD Sections
Section 3.2: Ticket Management (Lines 122-166)

title: GAP-A1.1: Workspace Path Validation
description:
## PRD Reference
Lines 179-182 of PRD-AMENDMENT-001-WORKSPACE-PATH.md

## Specification
- Path must be an absolute filesystem path
- Path should exist (warning if not)
- Path should not overlap with another project's workspace

## Current Status
PARTIAL - Path collected and stored, but NO validation that path exists, NO warning for invalid paths, NO duplicate detection.

## Implementation Requirements
- Backend: Validate path existence (non-blocking)
- Frontend: Show checkmark/warning indicator
- Backend: Check for duplicate paths
- Frontend: Warning modal for duplicates

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Path existence checked on blur
- [ ] Green checkmark for valid paths
- [ ] Warning for non-existent paths
- [ ] Warning for duplicate paths
close_reason: Implemented by swarm agent: Backend validation API, PathValidationIndicator component, DuplicatePathWarningModal, 14 unit tests. All acceptance criteria met.

title: GAP-3.1.2: Resource Allocation Dashboard
description:
## PRD Reference
Line 114 of PRD-AI-KANBAN-2045.md

## Specification
Resource allocation: CPU, memory, max agents per project

## Current Status
NOT IMPLEMENTED - Project.settings JSON field exists but has no schema for resource limits, and no UI.

## Implementation Requirements
- Define resource limit schema in Project.settings
- Backend: Enforce limits during swarm spawn
- UI: Resource allocation form in project settings
- Monitoring: Display current vs. allocated resources

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Resource limits configurable per project
- [ ] Limits enforced during agent spawn
- [ ] Usage vs. allocation displayed

title: EPIC: Learning Dashboard & Memory
description:
## Overview
Features for exploring learned patterns, neural training progress, and cross-project knowledge transfer.

## Child Issues
- GAP-3.4.1: Neural Training Progress Dashboard Data (cf-kanban-058)
- GAP-3.4.2: Memory Browser Semantic Search (cf-kanban-m1x)
- GAP-3.4.3: Cross-Project Insights Dashboard (cf-kanban-zqp)
- GAP-3.4.4: Pattern Transfer Between Projects (cf-kanban-e1c)

## Success Criteria
Users can visualize what Claude has learned, search patterns semantically, and transfer knowledge between projects.

## PRD Sections
Section 3.4: Learning Dashboard (Lines 188-227)

title: EPIC: Infrastructure & Production Readiness
description:
## Overview
Infrastructure, deployment, and operational features needed for production readiness.

## Child Issues
- GAP-ROAD.1: Redis Integration Completion (cf-kanban-7tl)
- GAP-ROAD.2: Production Deployment Configuration (cf-kanban-yc1)
- GAP-3.5.1: Notification Preferences UI (cf-kanban-92u)
- GAP-3.5.2: System Health Alerts (cf-kanban-xrc)
- GAP-A1.1: Workspace Path Validation (cf-kanban-amd)
- GAP-A1.2: Open in Editor Quick Action (cf-kanban-3rq)
- GAP-UX.1: KanbanCard AI Status Indicators (cf-kanban-ije)

## Success Criteria
System is deployable to production with proper monitoring, notifications, and operational tooling.

## PRD Sections
Phase 2, 5 Roadmap + Section 3.5 + Amendment-001

title: GAP-8.4: Capabilities Browser in Sidebar
description:
## PRD Reference
Lines 479-508 of PRD-AI-KANBAN-2045.md

## Specification
Capabilities Browser with expandable tree: Agents (60+), Hooks (27), Workers (12)

## Current Status
PARTIAL - Sidebar exists but no expandable capabilities tree, no browsable list of agents/hooks/workers.

## Implementation Requirements
- Add expandable capability tree to sidebar
- Link to full catalog pages
- Show counts dynamically

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Sidebar shows Capabilities section
- [ ] Expandable tree with counts
- [ ] Links to full catalog pages
close_reason: Implemented CapabilitiesTree.svelte with expandable sections for Agents/Hooks/Workers, dynamic counts, and links to catalog pages

title: GAP-3.2.6: Feedback Interaction UI Enhancement
description:
## PRD Reference
Lines 149-164 of PRD-AI-KANBAN-2045.md

## Specification
Enhanced feedback UI with clarification button and prominent display.

## Current Status
PARTIAL - TicketQuestions.svelte implements question UI, but missing 'Ask Claude to Clarify' button, no visual preview, questions not prominently displayed on Kanban cards.

## Implementation Requirements
- Add clarification request button
- Show question indicator on card in NEEDS_FEEDBACK lane
- Expand questions inline or modal from card click

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] 'Ask Claude to Clarify' button works
- [ ] Question indicator visible on cards
- [ ] Questions expandable from card click
close_reason: Implemented by swarm agent: Ask Claude to Clarify button, question indicator badge on cards, TicketDetailModal for expandable questions, clarify API endpoint. All acceptance criteria met.

title: GAP-3.1.5: Swarm Topology Configuration UI
description:
## PRD Reference
Line 112 of PRD-AI-KANBAN-2045.md

## Specification
Configure swarm topology per project (mesh, hierarchical, hybrid)

## Current Status
PARTIAL - Project.settings can store topology, but no UI for selecting it and no visual explanation.

## Implementation Requirements
- UI: Topology selector with visual diagrams
- Tooltip explanations for each topology type
- Verify topology is passed to CLI swarm init

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Users can select topology from dropdown
- [ ] Visual diagram shows topology structure
- [ ] Tooltips explain when to use each type
- [ ] Selected topology is used during swarm init
close_reason: Implemented by swarm: API endpoints, UI components, and integrations created

title: EPIC: Agent Orchestration & Visualization
description:
## Overview
Core agent orchestration features that enable users to discover, monitor, and configure AI agents.

## Child Issues
- GAP-3.3.1: Visual Agent Catalog (cf-kanban-z0l)
- GAP-3.3.2: Swarm Visualization (cf-kanban-n4s)
- GAP-3.3.3: Agent Status on Ticket Cards (cf-kanban-gwf)
- GAP-3.3.4: Agent Success Metrics (cf-kanban-mxy)
- GAP-3.3.5: Custom Agent Configuration (cf-kanban-pvn)

## Success Criteria
Users can browse available agents, see active swarms in real-time, and track agent performance metrics.

## PRD Sections
Section 3.3: Agent Orchestration (Lines 168-186)

title: GAP-3.2.2: Suggested Agent Assignment
description:
## PRD Reference
Line 133 of PRD-AI-KANBAN-2045.md

## Specification
Suggested agent assignment based on learned patterns

## Current Status
NOT IMPLEMENTED - agent-router.ts and pattern-matcher.ts exist but not connected to ticket UI.

## Implementation Requirements
- Call agent-router during ticket analysis
- Display suggested agents on ticket creation form
- Show confidence scores for suggestions
- Allow user to accept/modify suggestions

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Ticket form shows agent suggestions
- [ ] Confidence scores displayed
- [ ] Users can accept or modify suggestions
- [ ] Suggestions improve based on patterns
close_reason: Implemented by swarm: API endpoints, UI components, and integrations created

title: GAP-3.4.4: Pattern Transfer Between Projects
description:
## PRD Reference
Line 209 of PRD-AI-KANBAN-2045.md

## Specification
Transfer patterns between projects

## Current Status
NOT IMPLEMENTED - No mechanism to copy/share patterns from one project to another.

## Implementation Requirements
- API: Pattern transfer endpoint
- UI: 'Transfer to project' action on patterns
- Validation: Check pattern compatibility
- History: Track all transfers

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Patterns can be transferred via UI
- [ ] Transfer validation works
- [ ] Transfer history tracked

title: EPIC: Project Workspace Configuration
description:
## Overview
Project-level configuration features including templates, topology selection, and resource management.

## Child Issues
- GAP-3.1.1: Project Templates (cf-kanban-1t4)
- GAP-3.1.2: Resource Allocation Dashboard (cf-kanban-az2)
- GAP-3.1.3: Learning Preferences Configuration (cf-kanban-i10)
- GAP-3.1.4: Multi-Project Dashboard Statistics (cf-kanban-jw2)
- GAP-3.1.5: Swarm Topology Configuration UI (cf-kanban-d8c)

## Success Criteria
Users can quickly set up projects with templates and configure swarm behavior per project.

## PRD Sections
Section 3.1: Project Workspace (Lines 108-120)

title: GAP-3.3.3: Agent Status on Ticket Cards
description:
## PRD Reference
Line 183 of PRD-AI-KANBAN-2045.md

## Specification
Color-coded agent status (idle, working, blocked, learning) displayed on ticket cards.

## Current Status
NOT IMPLEMENTED - Tickets in IN_PROGRESS show no information about which agents are assigned or their current status.

## Implementation Requirements
- Track assigned agents per ticket
- Display agent avatars/icons on card
- Show agent status (working, waiting, blocked)
- Real-time updates via WebSocket

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Tickets show assigned agent(s) when in progress
- [ ] Agent status is color-coded on cards
- [ ] Status updates in real-time
- [ ] Multiple agents can be shown on one ticket
close_reason: Implemented agent status display on ticket cards with real-time updates

title: GAP-8.3: Interactive Tutorials for New Users
description:
## PRD Reference
Lines 631-658 of PRD-AI-KANBAN-2045.md

## Specification
Interactive Tutorials with Quick Start, Full Tour, Ask Claude, Read Docs paths.

## Current Status
NOT IMPLEMENTED - No onboarding flow or tutorials for new users.

## Implementation Requirements
- First-visit detection (localStorage/DB)
- Welcome modal with path selection
- Step-by-step guided tour component
- Progress tracking
- 'Skip' and 'Remind me later' options

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] First-time users see welcome modal
- [ ] Multiple onboarding paths available
- [ ] Step-by-step tour highlights features
- [ ] Progress tracked and resumable

title: GAP-3.1.3: Learning Preferences Configuration
description:
## PRD Reference
Line 113 of PRD-AI-KANBAN-2045.md

## Specification
Set learning preferences (share patterns globally or keep private)

## Current Status
NOT IMPLEMENTED - No UI or backend logic for controlling pattern sharing scope.

## Implementation Requirements
- Add learningConfig to Project settings schema
- UI: Toggle for 'Share patterns across projects'
- Backend: Filter patterns by project when private
- Pattern transfer to respect privacy settings

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Privacy toggle in project settings
- [ ] Private patterns filtered from global search
- [ ] Pattern transfer respects settings

title: GAP-UX.1: KanbanCard AI Status Indicators
description:
## PRD Reference
Line 745 of PRD-AI-KANBAN-2045.md (Appendix B)

## Specification
KanbanCard with AI status indicators, knowledge ring, confidence display.

## Current Status
NOT IMPLEMENTED - Current KanbanCard shows only title, description, priority, labels. Missing AI indicators.

## Implementation Requirements
- Extend KanbanCard with AI status section
- Animated status indicators
- Confidence meter component
- Knowledge ring visualization

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] AI status indicator on cards (working/thinking/blocked)
- [ ] Knowledge ring shows pattern familiarity
- [ ] Confidence percentage displayed
- [ ] Agent avatar shown when assigned
close_reason: Implemented by swarm agent: AIStatusIndicator, ConfidenceMeter, KnowledgeRing, AgentAvatar, AIStatusSection components + ai-status store. 27 unit tests. All acceptance criteria met.

title: GAP-8.2: Command Palette (Cmd+K)
description:
## PRD Reference
Lines 606-629 of PRD-AI-KANBAN-2045.md

## Specification
Command Palette (Cmd+K) with fuzzy search for all capabilities.

## Current Status
NOT IMPLEMENTED - No global keyboard shortcut or command palette exists.

## Implementation Requirements
- Install/build cmdk-style component
- Index all agents, hooks, workers, actions
- Fuzzy search implementation
- Action execution from palette
- Keyboard navigation (arrows, enter)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Cmd+K opens command palette
- [ ] Fuzzy search finds agents/hooks/workers
- [ ] Actions executable from palette
- [ ] Keyboard navigation works
close_reason: Implemented Command Palette with Cmd+K shortcut, fuzzy search for 60+ agents/27 hooks/12 workers, keyboard navigation, and CommandPalette.svelte component

title: GAP-3.1.4: Multi-Project Dashboard Statistics
description:
## PRD Reference
Line 111 of PRD-AI-KANBAN-2045.md

## Specification
Visual indication of Claude Code instance status, health, and aggregate statistics.

## Current Status
PARTIAL - Projects created successfully but no health/connectivity indicator, no aggregate statistics.

## Implementation Requirements
- Add project health status component
- Display active agent count per project
- Show last activity timestamp

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Health indicator per project card
- [ ] Active agent count shown
- [ ] Last activity timestamp displayed

title: GAP-3.4.2: Memory Browser Semantic Search
description:
## PRD Reference
Lines 202-206 of PRD-AI-KANBAN-2045.md

## Specification
Memory Browser with semantic search and vector similarity neighbors.

## Current Status
PARTIAL - /learning/memory page exists with namespace browsing, search UI, add entry form. But search is keyword-based not vector similarity, and no similarity neighbors view.

## Implementation Requirements
- Backend: Vector search endpoint using HNSW
- UI: 'Similar patterns' panel on entry detail
- Visual: Embedding similarity visualization

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Search uses vector similarity (HNSW)
- [ ] Similar patterns shown for each entry
- [ ] Similarity scores displayed
close_reason: Implemented by swarm agent: HNSW vector search API, SimilarPatterns component, keyword/vector toggle, similarity visualization, 25 new tests. All acceptance criteria met.

title: GAP-3.3.4: Agent Success Metrics
description:
## PRD Reference
Line 176 of PRD-AI-KANBAN-2045.md

## Specification
Track agent performance: task type, success rate, average completion time

## Current Status
NOT IMPLEMENTED - No tracking of agent performance metrics.

## Implementation Requirements
- Add AgentMetrics model or JSON field
- Track: tasks completed, success rate, avg duration
- Aggregate across projects
- Display in Agent Catalog

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Agent success rate tracked per task
- [ ] Completion times recorded
- [ ] Metrics aggregated and displayed
- [ ] Historical trends available
close_reason: Implemented agent success metrics with historical trends, sparklines, and real-time updates

title: GAP-3.3.2: Swarm Visualization
description:
## PRD Reference
Lines 181-186 of PRD-AI-KANBAN-2045.md

## Specification
Real-time visualization of active swarms:
- Node graph showing agent connections
- Color-coded status (idle, working, blocked, learning)
- Communication threads between agents
- Consensus voting indicators

## Current Status
NOT IMPLEMENTED - No swarm visualization component exists. Users cannot see what agents are doing.

## Implementation Requirements
- Create SwarmVisualization.svelte component
- WebSocket subscription to swarm events
- D3.js force-directed graph for agent network
- Real-time status color updates
- Communication flow animation
- Integrate into project page when swarm active

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Active swarm shows node graph of agents
- [ ] Agent status updates in real-time with colors
- [ ] Communication between agents is visualized
- [ ] Consensus voting indicators work
close_reason: Implemented real-time Swarm Visualization with D3.js force graph, status colors, health rings, consensus indicators, and WebSocket integration

title: GAP-3.3.5: Custom Agent Configuration
description:
## PRD Reference
Line 179 of PRD-AI-KANBAN-2045.md

## Specification
Custom agent configuration

## Current Status
NOT IMPLEMENTED - Users cannot customize agent behavior or create custom agent profiles.

## Implementation Requirements
- UI for agent configuration presets
- Save custom configs to project settings
- Apply configs when spawning agents

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Custom agent configs can be created
- [ ] Configs saved per project
- [ ] Configs applied during spawn

title: GAP-3.2.3: Estimated Completion Time
description:
## PRD Reference
Line 134 of PRD-AI-KANBAN-2045.md

## Specification
Estimated completion time from historical data

## Current Status
NOT IMPLEMENTED - time-estimation.ts has logic but no UI integration.

## Implementation Requirements
- Store actual completion times on Done tickets
- Build historical model by complexity/type
- Display estimate on ticket cards
- Update estimates as work progresses

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Completion times recorded
- [ ] Estimates shown on tickets
- [ ] Estimates update during work

title: GAP-8.5: Contextual Suggestions on Ticket Creation
description:
## PRD Reference
Lines 510-536 of PRD-AI-KANBAN-2045.md

## Specification
Contextual Suggestions when creating tickets: suggested agents, topology recommendation, similar past tickets with success rates.

## Current Status
NOT IMPLEMENTED - Ticket creation form has no suggestions.

## Implementation Requirements
- Analyze ticket content on blur/debounce
- Display agent suggestions
- Show topology recommendation
- Query similar past tickets
- Display pattern matches with success %

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Agent suggestions appear while typing
- [ ] Topology recommendation shown
- [ ] Similar past tickets displayed
- [ ] Success rates shown for patterns

title: GAP-3.5.2: System Health Alerts
description:
## PRD Reference
Line 220 of PRD-AI-KANBAN-2045.md

## Specification
System health alerts for users.

## Current Status
PARTIAL - Health monitoring exists in health.ts but no user-facing alerts or dashboard.

## Implementation Requirements
- System status indicator in header
- Health alert toasts
- Status page route

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Status indicator in header
- [ ] Toast notifications for health issues
- [ ] /status page shows system health

title: GAP-ROAD.2: Production Deployment Configuration
description:
## PRD Reference
Line 395 of PRD-AI-KANBAN-2045.md (Phase 5)

## Specification
Production deployment configuration.

## Current Status
NOT IMPLEMENTED - No Dockerfile, docker-compose.yml, Kubernetes manifests, or CI/CD pipeline.

## Implementation Requirements
- Create Dockerfile for app
- Create docker-compose.yml for dev
- Create CI/CD pipeline (GitHub Actions)
- Document deployment process

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Dockerfile builds successfully
- [ ] docker-compose up works locally
- [ ] CI/CD pipeline runs tests
- [ ] Deployment documentation complete

title: GAP-3.3.1: Visual Agent Catalog
description:
## PRD Reference
Lines 175-179 of PRD-AI-KANBAN-2045.md

## Specification
Visual Agent Catalog with:
- Browse all agent types with capabilities
- Filter by task type, success rate, average completion time
- See which agents work best together
- Custom agent configuration

## Current Status
NOT IMPLEMENTED - No /agents or /capabilities/agents page exists. Users have no way to discover available agents.

## Implementation Requirements
- Create /learning/agents route
- Build AgentCatalog component with:
  - Grid/list view of all 60+ agents
  - Filter by category, success rate, usage
  - Agent detail panel with capabilities
  - 'Best paired with' agent suggestions
- Connect to Claude Flow CLI for agent metadata

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Users can browse all 60+ agent types
- [ ] Agents can be filtered by category and metrics
- [ ] Agent detail panel shows full capabilities
- [ ] Agent pairing suggestions are shown
close_reason: Implemented Visual Agent Catalog with 60+ agent types, filtering, search, grid/list views, and detail panel at /learning/agents

title: GAP-8.1: AI Chat Assistant
description:
## PRD Reference
Lines 539-603 of PRD-AI-KANBAN-2045.md

## Specification
AI Chat Assistant (The Key Feature):
- Natural language interface to all Claude Flow capabilities
- Answer 'What can I do?' questions about features
- Explain any agent, hook, or worker
- Create tickets via conversation
- Suggest optimal configurations

## Current Status
NOT IMPLEMENTED - This is described as the primary way users interact with features, but no chat component exists.

## Implementation Requirements
- Create ChatAssistant component
- Integrate with Claude API for responses
- Intent classification system
- Knowledge base of CF features
- Ticket creation from chat
- Capability search/explanation

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Chat panel accessible from any screen
- [ ] Users can ask about capabilities
- [ ] Chat can create tickets via conversation
- [ ] Agent/hook explanations are accurate
- [ ] Configuration suggestions are contextual

title: GAP-3.2.7: Natural Language Task Parsing
description:
## PRD Reference
Line 126 of PRD-AI-KANBAN-2045.md

## Specification
Natural language descriptions parsed for structured data.

## Current Status
PARTIAL - Tickets accept free-text but no NLP parsing, no auto-label suggestion, no routing hints extraction.

## Implementation Requirements
- Integrate LLM for description parsing
- Auto-suggest labels from description
- Extract technical requirements/hints

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Labels auto-suggested from description
- [ ] Technical requirements extracted
- [ ] Routing hints identified

title: GAP-3.4.3: Cross-Project Insights Dashboard
description:
## PRD Reference
Lines 207-210 of PRD-AI-KANBAN-2045.md

## Specification
Cross-Project Insights: which patterns transferred successfully, performance impact, attribution, opt-in/out controls.

## Current Status
NOT IMPLEMENTED - /learning/transfer page exists but appears to be placeholder.

## Implementation Requirements
- Track pattern origin (project, timestamp)
- Track transfer history
- Measure success rate post-transfer
- UI: Transfer success dashboard
- Opt-in/out controls per pattern

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Pattern origin tracked
- [ ] Transfer success measured
- [ ] Opt-in/out controls work
